content: My favorite thing since the invention of mozzarella sticks
Beautiful!
Love this background app. Best ever!!!

I second the notion of another reviewer: its a shame these are cropped when there is much more to the original artwork. Its doubly a shame as - on the live wallpaper - most of the artwork gets cut off when my device is in landscape.
I love the old pallette-change animations and the beautiful retro art. A bit heavy on power consumption though.

Absolutely LOVE this app. It's so cool, and it helps with my mindfulness. Every once in a while, I'll take a moment out of my day to just observe the beautiful animated pixel art. My one gripe is that the live wallpaper sometimes forgets what time it is and displays a different scene than the one in the app. I have to apply a different wallpaper, then reapply this app's live wallpaper a few times a week to get it to reset.
This is beautiful.

Wonderful app, love the live wallpaper. It would be even better if it supported having wallpapers spread over multiple screens, some of the original artwork is wide enough for multiple screens and it is sad to see the works of art cut down to one phone screen wide!
Read about this app (and artist) in the book Retro Tea Breaks. As an old school gamer, I love this style of artwork. You sir, are awesome üëç

It's so great to finally see these working again, and having it change throughout the day as my phone background is fantastic. Well worth the price :) Only issue is that you can set it to "background and lockscreen" or "just background", but you can't do "just lockscreen" ‚Äî but I think that's an Android limitation for live wallpapers (or just on my Samsung Galaxy S7). Either way it's not the developer's fault, but just something to be aware of if you want lockscreen only.
It's really beautiful but for some reason breaks every few days and I'm let with nothing but a pink background. Setting it to be this again works but after so many redos i just have up using it
Masterclass! Thank you Mr Ferrari!

Thank you for this amazing app, I've finally used it for a full year! I'm a big fan of Seize the Day's art and to see it adapted for phones was wonderful. I liked the little storyline bringing life to the landscapes, and the hunt feature making me pay attention to the landscapes more than I thought I would. No bugs on my S8!

Absolutely incredible pixel art by the brilliant Mark Ferrari. And not just the images but the preparation and setup that went into the color cycling effects for the rain, light, weather, and other effects! It's all just one image of indexed colours shifting through various palettes! Truly remarkable! I also quite like the journal entries and hunt checklist which keeps things interesting and a bit of fun. I want to play a p&c adventure about what these intriguing journal entries describe!
Pixel art masterpieces. Download this if you are even slightly curious. You won't be disappointed.
Absolutely beautiful pixel art scenes, I only wish there were ambient sounds like the web version! It's the only thing I think is missing. A lovely app to fire up and get lost in for a while.

I remember when these came out as a Chrome Experiment! I loved watching these. A few notes/suggestions though: a) there are some that were in the chrome experiment that aren't in the app, b) I'd love to be able to set the wallpaper to a specific time (i.e. night so I can see my icons on my homescreen better)

Amazing artwork! I love these animations since way back! I only wish the bottom android bar was not bright white as this is distracting for night scenes, or maybe it could auto-hide? (this is Samsung note 8)
Fantastic app, updating to five starts as I promised earlier once all issues were sorted out. Absolutely beautiful Mark Ferrari art as live wallpapers.
I love the art, but not only does the app frequently break, but the lock screen also just doesn't work. Enjoyable app worth of support, but not functional on all but standard devices.
I absolutly adore this app.

Absolutely beautiful, highly recommended for anyone who loves Mark's work. The images are detailed enough that a co-worker confused them for a photo at first glance; yet they reveal their full pixelated glory at second glance. The animations are smooth and subtle enough to be visible while not too distracting. Update: there used to be an issue with wallpapers set by this app resetting after a few days, but that seems to be resolved now.

It's everything I wanted since I first learned about Mr. Ferrari's art from that effect games website article on color cycling. I only wish Mark would make more of this awesome pixel art. I know there are other scenes made by Mark that weren't in the day planner, I hope to eventually have a way to put those up on my phone too.

Very cool for fans of pixel art. Sadly having to re-set background multiple times a week (reverting back to default background on both of my pixel phones). The art itself is magnificent. Stunning what can be done with just palette changes. Edit: it has gotten a lot better about not resetting the background now, but it does revert still (just not very often anymore, maybe once every two weeks or so)
replyContent: OK, good to know. Unfortunately I'm not sure why that's happening. Have you tried the "alt wallpaper tech" checkbox? It doesn't seem like it would address this issue, but it's worth a try.

content: Absolutely stunning! The 8-bit color scape scenes are amazing. And the level of details are fantastic. Love the Hunt and the Journal features. Also great how alive the scene seems. It really gets my imagination going. And it brings back fond memories of my teenage years discovering early video games. This is a gem and an work of art.
Should be able to use parallax effect, maybe make it compatible with those popular launchers or KLWP & KLGT will help? And add some widgets (clock, calendar,...) would be nice.
Gorgeous wallpapers, they deserve 5 stars but they disappear and need to be reset every day, sometimes twice a day. Please fix! Edit: fixed! :)
Beautiful pixel art live wallpaper.
Breathtaking
Great retro-style animated pixel art wallpapers
The absolute best wish they'd make games
Gorgeous scenes. Perfect as a live wallpaper These scenes may be decades old, but their still perfect on modern devices. I love that it's a calendar, with a new scene each month.
Thanks for adding zoom setting to the live wallpaper!

Love the look and settings. Incredible wallpapers. For some reason tho, when setting the image to wallpaper and choosing home and lockscreen, the wallpaper is only applied to the home screen. Would love to have this on my lockscreen! Would easily become a 5* rating. Please try to fix this.
replyContent: Strange‚Ä¶ I'm not sure why this would be happening. Is it still an issue now?

content: Love it
I absolutely adore this app! The dev is super responsive; he helped me fix a bug I had and now everything is working perfectly. Will keep this one installed for a long time.
replyContent: What kind of crash? Does it just go black, or is there an error message? Is it still happening? Please email ian@pixfabrik.com to follow up.

content: Really cool collection of pixel art. Amazing how great it looks. Had some issues with live wallpaper (was being disabled turning the background to just black). These might be resolved after the latest build.
Amazing art!
These are beautiful quality live wallpapers! I'm glad I found this. Thanks for (re)creating them!

EDIT - Fixed with update! Awesome developer Beautiful but live wallpapers are buggy. If you view other months that your live wallpaper, it turns the live wallpaper black and I can't find anything other than a reboot to fix it.
replyContent: I'm trying out a new display technique in an unreleased beta version that might fix this‚Ä¶ Would you be up for testing it out to see if it works for your phone? If so, please email ian@pixfabrik.com.

content: Amazing pixel art by the grandmaster himself, Mark Ferrari. Thank you!
Amazing Worlds! Loved this since the original program came out for my computer. Get this and tell someone else about it!
Absolutely beautiful. I love the moving art and the stories that accompany it. I've been following for a year and I don't plan on changing my wallpaper.

Such amazing pixel art! I really like the subtle animations and changes throughout the day. 5 stars for the artwork! Maybe only 3 or 4 stars for glitches and the wallpaper sometimes just being black. Seems like it could use some compatibility updates for more Android OS flavors like Oxygen OS for instance. Still my favorite wallpaper app though despite annoying glitches sometimes! üòÄüëç
I loved the original on my pc, so happy to have it back all these years later! It is an app that was ahead of it's time!

Stopped working on August 1st. Still not fixed. Update: fixed, and worked until the last day or two. It stuck on October and went to black. Manually chose December yesterday and now it only shows either a blinding white background or a dull grey.
replyContent: Strange! Well, I'm trying out a new display technique in an unreleased beta version‚Ä¶ Would you be up for testing it out to see if it fixes your issue? If so, please email ian@pixfabrik.com.

content: This app is lovely and now includes all 12 scenes! I'd seen the original art ages ago and I'm so glad to have it in a format where I can actually enjoy it. This was certainly worth the price I paid for it, and I can't recommend it enough to pixel art lovers. The most frustrating aspect is that you don't have the ability to adjust the live wallpaper's cropping. Most of the time this is fine, but in December's scene it drives me nuts that I can't center the view on the house @_@
Beautiful and great animated wallpaper

Really beautiful and magical. Is it possible to make it so you can change the way it is cropped or allow scrolling so we can see the entire image? I only get to see the entire imagine in the app itself and I am worried I'm missing things because of how cropped it is. Thank you thank you!!
I love this! December is my favourite month scene, followed closely by May. Luscious and gorgeous!
Near instant response from the developer, that's great support!
replyContent: Sorry to hear that! What's it doing? Please email me at ian@pixfabrik.com so I can help sort it out!

content: The app works really well, it has all of the beautiful pixel art that you would come to expect, and it even has some surprises like a shooting star or individual lights turning on and off. However, there are still a couple bugs, like when switching between wallpapers and some other features. Otherwise, very cool app.
Found Mark Ferrari's amazing pixel art collection years ago, I'm so happy it was made into a living wallpaper app! The wallpaper changes throughout the day too. I love it so much!!

Had to restart on the Galaxy s10 to get it work, but now that I did that it's 10/10! Seriously some of the best live phone wallpapers I've seen, and the knowledge that they were created a year after I was born sort of hurts my brain
These are beautiful pixel art that are ideal for wallpapers. November update fixed for me whatever was conflicting with the recent Android update. Thanks!
replyContent: It looks like the "blackout" we encountered with WebView 76 has partially returned now that WebView 78 is out. Some people say restarting their phone fixes it‚Ä¶ Can you give that a try? Contact me at ian@pixfabrik.com if you need further help.

content: oh my goodness, i cant believe this is available as a live wallpaper. i have loved these images for years! fastest purchase ever. Still excellent.
I really like it, although I wish I could set the time for my live wallpaper and keep it there instead of it just defaulting to my current time.

I can't believe I woke up in the middle of the night thinking how cool it'd be to make Living Worlds a live wallpaper for my phone. I jolted out of bed ready to do some coding, but lo and behold. It had existed starting this year! What a great coincidence. Fastest 2 dollars I've ever spent. Looks as good as I imagined it would. Remarkable and timeless works of art. Thank you, thank you, thank you.

An issue where the live wallpaper feature didn't work has been fixed, and now works fine. Watching this lovely pixel art change throughout the day as I check my phone is a real treat. It's still as gorgeous now as it was 20 years ago on my old Windows 3.1 computer.
Beautiful artwork!

Edit: Live wallpaper works great now, thanks! I remember learning about the seize the day program and the living worlds artwork about 5 years ago, and I was delighted to see that the amazing pixel art has come to Android! It's great to see the art live on in a modern format. I can't wait for the live wallpaper functionality to be restored, but until then I'll be enjoying the art work from inside the app.
replyContent: The new version of Chrome/WebView (77) is out, so the live wallpaper should be working again (assuming your phone has updated). Please let me know if you have any trouble with it!

content: Amazing app, five stars if it wouldn't zoom in for the live wallpaper!

Quaint scenic app. The live background feature is working, and the small narrative developing through the logs each month is a cute touch. It makes my phone more personal and brightens my day. I look forward to each update.
A e s t h e t i c
Excellent graphics, cool live wallpaper.
replyContent: Looks like you got the live wallpaper working :-)

content: amazing
Amazingly beautiful, i just wished the live wallpaper could move as I scroll horizontally through the screen. The art and my screen have different resolutions so it is already zoomed in:/
I abosuletly love this app. I recommend it to others constantly. I'm so happy to have it back after the Chrome 76 bug. Its the only app I have ever paid money for. Thanks Mark!

This is the best $2 I've ever spent. Could you maybe make it so that when we scroll left/right on the home screen it scrolls through the scenes? We can see that it zoomed in when we disable fill mode in the app, so there's the space to do scrolling.
So soothing and sweet. I like to look at it and see things happen. Rain, lights turn on and off, little creatures wandering around. It is very nice and interesting!

Loving it. Here are a few suggestions that would make this even better: 1) Parallax effect (i.e. background pans when swiping across home screens), 2) Option to fix the wallpaper to a specific time, 3) Matching the local sun set/rise times, 4) Matching the local weather
Beautiful live wallpaper experience! The scenes are fantastic and there's always something to look at. Better yet I can go into the app and always find a scene and time to fit my current mood!
i love it so much. i unlock my phone just to watch the beautiful imagery and chill out. today i took a screenshot because a pretty fish swam by! thank you so much for this
unfortunately the august update broke the wallpaper feature. its just a black screen now.
replyContent: The new version of Chrome/WebView (77) is out, so the live wallpaper should be working again (assuming your phone has updated). Please let me know if you have any trouble with it!

content: The scenes are stunning and the app works well, but the live wallpaper (the main reason I bought it) is just black. Edit: Nevermind, just read the description.
replyContent: The new version of Chrome/WebView (77) is out, so the live wallpaper should be working again (assuming your phone has updated). Please let me know if you have any trouble with it!

content: love it, fun and pretty
seems cool, but why doesn't the live wallpaper function work on my Samsung Galaxy S9!?
replyContent: The new version of Chrome/WebView (77) is out, so the live wallpaper should be working again (assuming your phone has updated). Please let me know if you have any trouble with it!

content: Awesome app and a responsive developer. 5 stars.
replyContent: The new version of Chrome/WebView (77) is out, so the live wallpaper should be working again (assuming your phone has updated). Please let me know if you have any trouble with it!

content: I've wanted something like this since since I discovered the art. I made a version that runs on a raspberry pi for my desk, but this app is way more convenient. Also you should add in support for a landscape mode. I found on my pi version that a horizontal stretch looks perfectly fine.
replyContent: We're using the portrait-mode artwork from the original 1993 app; the landscape-mode art from the web demo doesn't have all of the extra features, and the copyright there is a bit muddy. More info: http://pixfabrik.com/livingworlds/support/

content: I honestly can't give this enough stars. With the addition of live wallpapers for your phone I am honestly surprised this app is still free. LOVE everything about it!
perfect
Beautiful paintings. I love to discover all these tiny details every time I use the phone.
dope af
Stunningly beautiful
ive loved these art pieces since i first saw them almost 15 years ago. now they're a living wallpaper set and i couldnt be happier with them.
I look forward to each months new wallpaper. Seeing this wallpaper brightens my day.
great art, but it's been cropped to fit the phone and there's no way to turn off pixel smoothing on my Galaxy s3

I love this app! As a kid I loved reading books with Mark Ferrari's colored pencil illustrations, and playing the early computer games that he contributed pixel art to. Now I can look at his work every day! üòä

Absolutely stunning app - Finally a live wallpaper worth using. Would really appreciate an ability to cycle through each month every couple of days or something though! June's one is a bit boring to look at compares to previous months.

The art is stunning, and in motion is frankly incredible. But sadly on my device (oneplus 6, android P) the live wallpaper does not function correctly and gets stuck on a single frame of the animation, which only changes if you enter the app itself and exit again. A fix so that the wallpaper works as expected would make this a five star review straight away :)
i love this app!!!!! the art is so beautiful!!!!!!
makes me happy and relaxed every time I open it.
One of the few live wallpapers you'd ever want. Nice and subtle; absolutely stunning. üëç It'd be great to have a setting to cycle through these and get a different one every day.
Kinda cool, but only seems to be one image, not five like the blurb suggests

Amazing art and a steal at two bucks. There's a huge amount of variety for each scene and even some easter eggs for you to find. If you loved old Lucasarts point and click adventures you'll really enjoy these little worlds.

Delightful to see these living worlds once again. I had enjoyed the HTML5 version some time ago, and was vaguely aware of the original program, seeing these wonderful graphical showpieces again delights me. The scavenger hunt and logbook are a cute touch, but one (or two) small touch may be missing if you prefer. There is no sound, and no screensaver option. Otherwise, fantastic all around.

I've never felt the novelty of a live wallpaper -- until today.  I eagerly await the monthly updates but with the 5 months already implemented (and honestly from what I've seen, mostly my favorite anyways), I really wish I could rate it beyond 5. This recreation of such classics is astounding.
Amazing!!! I've wanted these backgrounds for years and I'm extremely excited that they're finally available--and from an official source I can support as well. :]

Extremely well done wallpapers however I cant seem to be able to set them as live wallpapers on my oneplus6 pie stock launcher. All I'm getting is a white background with no movment present. Please do something about it. Update: after fiddling around with it I got it working by cycling through a few static wallpapers before selecting it directly from the launchers settings.

Very beautiful, nice too look at and has smooth animation. Very low CPU usage as well. Would you be willing to update the app to include offsetting the time of day for each wallpaper? I've noticed that you can skim through the time of day while previewing each wallpaper, but cannot save them that way. I'd like to try and match the sunset in the wallpaper to that of real life so that their timing is synced üòÅ
the only critique I have of this app is that he hasn't done this for every single one of his works

I was a big fan of Seize the Day and pretty much anything Ian Gilman touched (Ishido, Heaven and Earth etc). This does not disappoint! Its a beautiful experience and I highly reccomend it! Now if we can just get Ian to remake Ishido.... ;)

Absolutely beautiful. Now that Live Wallpapers were added, I had no choice but to dive in. I love this art. My only suggestion (hence the 4 stars instead of 5) is that it would be nice if there was an option to use the full zoomed-out scene for the Live Wallpaper; yes, that might result in black bars around the image, but personally, I wouldn't mind that. Alternatively, if there was also a way to move around the Live Wallpaper so you could choose to be zoomed on a specific part.
So utterly gorgeous and unique!

I have dearly loved and enjoyed Living Worlds since the beginning.  There has not been anything like it ever since... I do miss the journal and daily sayings with the calendar and wish you could bring those back too:)  In the meantime, I am enjoying everyday of my Living Worlds on my desktop and phone.  Thank you so much for listening to your avid fans and bringing back such a beautiful daily experience:)  There is a beautiful world and time of day for each one of us.
With the latest updates this is now my favorite app ever. The pixel art is so ethereally beautiful and seeing it every time i open up my lock screen is a pleasure.
Finally a live wallpaper!! Absolutely gorgeous & I can give it 5 stars now ‚ò∫Ô∏è
With live wallpapers - fantastic. Would be nice if the fulscreen version of the wallpaper zoomed to the "interesting" part of the picture, instead of the actual centre.
Absolutely fantastic, and the live wallpaper feature makes this absolutely unmissable
Fantastic! A good rework of the original software! Now with live wallpapers!
Beautiful!
Amazing, the first thing ive ever purchased off the play store. One suggestion would be to have landscape mode.

This is so wonderful. I've had copies of some of these for years that I enjoyed, but not easily. This app is something I've wished for. I plan to hang some old tablets on my wall running this app. This app also keeps getting better every month!
love your pictures. looking forward to live wallpaper and all the other pictures.
very pretty, but a live wallpaper version and full screen support would be very nice. edit: full screen support added! thank you
Nostalgic, beautiful art. So happy for this month's update!
Love it. This is some of the best pixel art ever created, and it looks really nice on a HiDPI smartphone screen. Eager to see more scenes and live wallpaper support added in future releases.
Needs live wallpaper support.
Amazing art! Would love to see them as Live Wallpapers someday. Nonetheless I enjoy the sceneries.
Gorgeous, but I purchased it thinking it was live wallpaper. THIS IS NOT LIVE WALLPAPER. Not sure what I'm gonna do with it, but hey. Live and learn.

After all these years since the Seize the Day calendar software, it's wonderful to see these living worlds coming back to life. As others have said, I'd love to have the ability to set this as a live wallpaper and/or lock screen animation. Also, on my Samsung the image doesn't show full screen. I'm not sure if that's intended but I'd love to see it fill the entire screen. Anyway, the app has only just been released and I'm really looking forward to seeing new worlds in future months. I hope this app will receive the support it deserves so it can continue to grow and develop. It's beautiful.
Bought this right away to show my support. It's pretty nice so far, though could it have Live Wallpaper support?
Brilliant! I stared at Seize the Day so much back in the day. The only thing I could ask for is a live wallpaper so I can stick this on my lock screen.
